item.title: 俄罗斯将维持利率在纪录高位，处于观望状态
item.description: 俄罗斯央行将在第三次会议上将利率维持在历史最高水平，人们对开始放松货币政策的预期正在形成。【原文：Russia’s central bank is set to hold interest rates at a historic high for a third meeting, with expectations building that a start to monetary easing is in the offing.】

item.title: 马斯克呼吁特斯拉员工在股票下跌 40% 的情况下继续持有股票
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周四在德克萨斯州奥斯汀举行了一次未事先宣布的全体员工大会，试图向特斯拉公司员工保证，尽管 "时局动荡"，但他们应该 "坚持持有 "自己的股票。【原文：Elon Musk sought to reassure Tesla Inc. employees that despite “rocky moments,” they should “hang onto” their stock, in an unannounced all-hands meeting Thursday in Austin, Texas, which the billionaire chief executive streamed live on his social media network X.】

item.title: 中国进口美国商品和汽车在新一轮贸易战中崩溃
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普开始征收关税后，中国对美国棉花、汽车和一些能源产品的进口在今年头两个月大幅下降，而中国政府则采取了报复行动。【原文：China’s imports of US cotton, cars and some energy products all plunged in the first two months of the year after President Donald Trump started imposing tariffs and Beijing retaliated.】

item.title: 美国关税压力上升，日中两国将举行经济会谈
item.description: 日本和中国将于本周六举行六年来的首次经济对话，此次活动旨在缓解亚洲巨头面临美国贸易压力时的紧张局势。【原文：Japan and China are set to hold their first economic dialogue in six years on Saturday, an event aimed at reducing tensions as the Asian giants face trade pressure from the US.】

item.title: 通胀加剧，日本家庭以创纪录的速度削减现金
item.description: 日本央行的最新数据显示，日本家庭上季度以有史以来最快的速度减少了集体现金储备，以应对不断上涨的生活成本。【原文：Japan’s households reduced their collective stash of cash at the fastest pace on record last quarter as they sought to cope with rising costs of living, according to the latest data by the Bank of Japan.】

item.title: 中国钢铁业计划对关闭的老钢厂进行补偿
item.description: 在政府努力控制中国巨大产量的背景下，中国钢铁行业正在考虑向企业支付关闭落后钢铁厂的费用。【原文：China’s steel industry is considering paying firms to shutter outdated steel plants, amid government efforts to rein in the country’s mammoth output.】

item.title: 波普超市、海迪乐、农夫山泉为中国消费定调
item.description: 一项调查显示，消费者越来越乐观，而中国政府也提出了通过提高收入来振兴消费的计划，在此之前，中国的消费巨头将在下周的财报中占据主导地位。【原文：Chinese consumer giants dominate next week’s earnings after a survey showed consumers are feeling increasingly optimistic and Beijing outlined plans to revive consumption by boosting incomes.】

item.title: 鸿海获得三菱汽车首个电动汽车生产大客户
item.description: 鸿海精密工业股份有限公司已与三菱汽车公司（Mitsubishi Motors Corp.【原文：Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. has secured an agreement to make Mitsubishi Motors Corp. electric vehicles, scoring the first major customer for its fledging EV contract manufacturing business.】

item.title: 中国在伦敦首次发行主权绿色债券
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，中国财政部已授权银行销售人民币计价的三年期和五年期绿色债券，这些债券将在伦敦首次上市。【原文：China’s Ministry of Finance has mandated banks for the sale of yuan-denominated three-year and five-year green bonds for an inaugural listing in London, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普在关税问题上的 "大动作 "令新兴市场交易商惶恐不安
item.description: 迫在眉睫的美国新关税大潮让新兴市场的交易员们一闻到风险的蛛丝马迹就蠢蠢欲动。【原文：The looming barrage of fresh US tariffs is leaving traders in emerging markets ready to bolt at the slightest whiff of risk.】

item.title: 受美国制裁的永泰科技面临严重损失，将剥离资产
item.description: 苹果公司和其他电子产品制造商的中国供应商闻泰科技公司（Wingtech Technology Co.【原文：Wingtech Technology Co., a Chinese supplier to Apple Inc. and other electronics makers, has agreed to spin off a major piece of its operations after US sanctions threaten to bring heavy losses.】

item.title: 中国将增加钴和铜的国有金属储备
item.description: 中国计划在今年增加主要工业金属的战略储备，在能源转型需求增加和地缘政治局势高度紧张之际，努力提高关键矿产供应的弹性。【原文：China plans to add to its strategic reserves of key industrial metals this year, an effort to boost the resilience of critical minerals supply at time when energy-transition demand is increasing and geopolitical tensions are running high.】

item.title: 贸易战担忧加剧，黄金接近历史最高水平
item.description: 由于对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普关税潜在影响的担忧支撑了避险买家的需求，黄金维持在纪录高位附近。【原文：Gold held near a record high as concerns about the potential impacts of US President Donald Trump’s tariffs supported demand from haven buyers.】

item.title: 据说 CoreWeave 首次公开募股首日即获得超额认购
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，CoreWeave 公司预计将向潜在投资者说明，其首次公开募股已收到所有可用股票的订单。【原文：CoreWeave Inc. is expected to guide prospective investors that its initial public offering has received orders for all of the shares available, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: GfK 称，英国高收入者终于准备好挥霍了
item.description: 一份报告显示，英国最富有的人将释放他们的积蓄，在奢侈品、汽车或科技产品上大肆挥霍，这表明较低的利率正在刺激需求。【原文：The UK’s richest are set to unleash their savings to splash on luxury goods, cars or tech, a report showed, in signs that lower interest rates are boosting demand.】

item.title: 各国央行在特朗普贸易战的迷雾中缓慢前行
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普已经颠覆了全球贸易和战后国际安全共识。现在，他又让中央银行陷入混乱。【原文：US President Donald Trump has already upended global trade and the postwar international security consensus. Now he’s throwing central banking into disarray.】

item.title: 普拉博沃面临投资者对印尼经济发展道路的质疑
item.description: 几个月来，印尼总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）削弱印尼长期以来建立的经济保护措施的举动激起了市场的焦虑。本周的突然溃败表明投资者的耐心正在消磨殆尽。【原文：For months, President Prabowo Subianto’s moves to chip away at Indonesia’s long-established economic guardrails have stoked anxiety in markets. This week’s sudden rout suggests investor patience is wearing thin.】

item.title: 韩国早期贸易数据显示出口反弹
item.description: 韩国的早期贸易数据显示，本月出口反弹，这为努力保护经济免受唐纳德-特朗普关税运动影响的政策制定者提供了一些宽慰。【原文：South Korea’s early trade data showed exports bouncing back this month, offering some relief for policymakers struggling to shield the economy from the impact of Donald Trump’s tariffs campaign.】

item.title: 大米价格下跌让数十亿人受益，农民却面临风险
item.description: 从菲律宾到塞内加尔，数十亿人发现，由于大米价格从 15 年来的高位大幅下跌，养家糊口变得更加容易了。【原文：From the Philippines to Senegal, billions of people are finding it easier to feed their families now that rice prices have plunged off 15-year highs.】

item.title: 恢复能源补贴后日本通胀放缓
item.description: 在政府恢复补贴降低了公用事业成本之后，日本的消费者通胀率在四个月内首次放缓，这一结果支持了日本央行继续循序渐进地进一步加息。【原文：Japan’s consumer inflation slowed for the first time in four months after the resumption of government subsidies lowered utility costs, in a result that backs the case for the Bank of Japan to stay on a gradual path to further rate hikes.】

item.title: 美国对伊朗的制裁重创中国炼油厂，石油涨势扩大
item.description: 美国首次制裁一家中国炼油厂，明显加强了遏制来自伊朗的石油流动的措施，此后石油延续涨势。【原文：Oil extended gains after the US sanctioned a Chinese refinery for the first time in a marked step-up of measures to curb oil flows from Iran.】

item.title: 澳大利亚大选前的巨额预算可能会缓和澳大利亚央行的降息举措
item.description: 澳大利亚财政部长吉姆-查莫斯（Jim Chalmers）周二在议会公布选前预算时，将需要找到一种既能吸引选民，又能控制支出的方法。【原文：Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers will need to find a way of wooing voters while keeping spending under control when he hands down his pre-election budget in parliament on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美团股票的回报潜力在中国科技股中名列前茅
item.description: 美团周五晚些时候发布的财报将有助于评估其股价上涨空间是否如卖方分析师所预测的那样乐观。【原文：Meituan’s results due later Friday will help assess if its share price upside is as promising as sell-side analysts suggest.】

item.title: 贸易担忧挥之不去，亚洲股市有望下跌：市场综述
item.description: 由于交易员们权衡贸易战的影响和美国强劲的住房和就业数据，亚洲股市开始追随华尔街的跌势。【原文：Asian equities were primed to track declines on Wall Street as traders weighed the impact of a trade war against robust US housing and jobs data.】

item.title: 泰国或将实施本地区最激进的降息措施
item.description: 尽管面临巨大的政治压力，泰国央行长期以来一直抵制降息，但据分析师称，随着低迷的经济形势急转直下，泰国央行最终可能不得不启动该地区最激进的宽松周期。【原文：The Bank of Thailand, which has long resisted interest-rate cuts despite immense political pressure, may end up having to embark on the region’s most aggressive easing cycle as a sluggish economy takes a turn for the worse, according to analysts.】

item.title: 迈克-威尔逊认为上半年股市不会再创新高
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的迈克尔-威尔逊（Michael Wilson）表示，2025 年困扰华尔街的美国股市动荡局面可能至少持续到下半年，股票价格仍将低于上个月创下的高点。【原文：A volatile stretch for US equities that’s plagued Wall Street in 2025 is likely to persist until at least the second half of the year, with equity prices remaining below the highs hit last month, according to Morgan Stanley’s Michael Wilson.】
